Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Rhino- \Rhi"no-\ A combining form from Greek ??, ???, the nose, as in rhinolith, rhinology. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Rhino \Rhi*no\, n. [Etymol. uncertain.] Gold and silver, or money. [Cant] --W. Wagstaffe. [1913 Webster]
As long as the rhino lasted. --Marryat. [1913 Webster]
rhino n : massive powerful herbivorous odd-toed ungulate of southeast Asia and Africa having very thick skin and one or two horns on the snout [syn: {rhinoceros}]
